>Hi all,
>
>Below I've copied the code of a jsp, which contains links to it=
self
>with different query parameters. if heritrix visits those links, they=

>inturn, generate some new links(random) and these new links are stored
>i=
n frontier for processing later on. So this way every time it'll find
>a ne=
w link and it'll store those links in frontier for further
>processing.I us=
ed the below jsp with 10 such links and max-link-hops =3D
>10 and got thous=
ands of pages.
>Is there a way to prevent Heritrix from falling into such t=
raps? 
 
Yes, by creating custom filters on your scope (usually in an overr=
ide
directed at the particular host, but in your case it would have to be a=

general rule). 
 
Add a URI regular expression filter to the exclude filte=
rs on the scope (or
similar rule if using the deciding scope) and add a reg=
ular expression that
recognizes problematic URIs.
 
Presumably something li=
ke: ^.*sample\.jsp?a=3D[0-9]+.*$
 
You'll have to these on a case by case b=
asis.
 
Just for kicks I'll past in a few rules that I've created for .is c=
rawls.
These are applied to all hosts. There are also many host specific ru=
les.
 
^.*((woa/[0-9]/wo/)|(wosid=3D)).*$ (SoloWeb drasl) 
^.*(((fre_id=3D[=
0-9]+&meira=3D[0-9]*&){2,})|(^.*([fF][rR][eE]_[iI][dD]=3D[
0-9]+,%[=
0-9]+).*$)|((skalLeita=3D[0-9]+&){2,})).*$ 
^.*((%201)|(expand=3D([0-9]=
+\.){3,})|(ExpandSection=3D(-?[0-9]+(\.-?[0-9]+)?,?){
2,})).*$ 
^.*((multip=
lier=3D)|(ColorScheme=3D)|((%..){3,})|(post\.asp)).*$ 
^.*((karfa_add)|(log=
in\.php)|(posting\.php)|(newlang=3D)).*$ 
^.*(action=3D((buy_now)|(add_prod=
uct)|(notify)|(sign))).*$ 
^.*year=3D(([^2]...)|(2[^0]..)|(20[^0].)).*$ 
^.=
*&{2,}.*$ 
^.*print=3Dtrue.*$ 
 
- Kris

r("a"))).intValue()+Math.round((java.lang.Math.random()*

lo</a>

<http://192.168.102.3:8080/servlets-examples/s=
ample.jsp?a=3D<%=3D(Integer.valueO
f(request.getParameter(>
http://192.168.=
102.3:8080/servlets-examples/sample.jsp?a=3D<%=3D(Integer.valueOf
(request.=
getParameter("a"))).intValue()+Math.round((java.lang.Math.random()*
1000000=
00))%>">hello</a>
